My favorite of the line is number two due to its woodiness, citrus, and smoky notes<br />
<br />
rating<br />
<br />
bottle 9/10<br />
scent 5/10<br />
projection 5/10<br />
longevity 5/10<br />
overall 6.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="87945"comment_id="1979817"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html?ccid=1979817#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1979685" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1979685" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ghoulish.loser"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1532937"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1532937.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ghoulish.loser" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Phlur/Mood-Ring-88564.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.88564.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mood Ring"title="Mood Ring"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1979685ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1979685" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1532937">ghoulish.loser</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-18">11/18/23 13:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>definitely feels like the stereotypical cologne smell from an early 2000s magazine sample upon first smell. but im actually not mad at it?? after sitting on my skin for a little while, its actually quite nice. definitely reminds of no. 2 but softer. its very smooth, if that makes sense. like its not too brash or harsh like most stereotypical colognes are. it smells very warm and nostalgic to me. and the more i smell it, the more the opening notes are starting to remind me of juicy fruit gum lol in a good way! its actually really delicious once you get familiar with it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="87945"comment_id="1979685"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html?ccid=1979685#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1979225" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1979225" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="peacharena"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1896936"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="peacharena" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1979225ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1979225" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1896936">peacharena</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-17">11/17/23 22:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This has become a MAJOR favourite and I wish it was permanent because once I run out of it I will be quite sad! The summary: this is a peppery woodsy fragrance that dries down to a gentle amber (with very faint pepper notes). Not recommended if you don't like masculine scents at all. I think this leans more feminine rather than completely gender neutral, but if you don't like colognes at all and aren't interested in that type of vibe, avoid this altogether. I've never had a gender neutral fragrance so was on the fence, but this is absolutely divine. Super detailed review if you're looking to blind buy.<br />
<br />
Astringent on the first spray. Pepper note is most noticeable. I dont smell grapefruit, just acidity and pepperiness. That mellows out within 20 seconds where you can smell more amber-y creamy notes. Within the first minute I smell a faint warm jasmine with a hint of pepper (all astringent notes are gone). Jasmine isnt very floral its almost barely there. Smells a bit resinous too but not overpoweringly. Pepper note smells like black pepper with a mix of floral-y sichuan peppercorn (I don't like peppery scents but for some reason it works here, probably the warmth of the amber). After 3-4 minutes the dry down is warm and creamy almost whipped-cream or ice cream-like on my skin with a slight hint of masculine piney/resinous scent. It's sort of powdery in a lightly spicy way. Smells wonderful on clothing too<br />
<br />
Wear time: wears similarly to no. 1 surprisingly. I can apply it in the evening and it will still be on my skin into the next day. The difference for me is no 1 smells a lot stronger whereas no. 3s dry down is even lighter and sweeter/creamier. Its very pleasant.<br />
<br />
No.1 is a lot more ambery and sweeter/sugary. No. 1 is almost 3x as strong on first spray. They both share a very similar creamy ambery musky base note. The main difference is the pepperiness and the tree resin smell. No. 3 is also much lighter. Perfect if youre scent sensitive as it provides a robust feeling fragrance while not being overpowering at all on the skin. I smell it on myself throughout the day but not as much as no. 1, its more of a scent to smell intentionally on yourself or someone else. If youre nervous about the more unisex fragrances this is therefore a safer blind buy because it is more masculine but not too strong. Its a masculinely feminine perfume to me. A nice robust but not overpowering fragrance on a woman that would be like a gentle fragrance on a man. Its addicting to smell throughout the day.<br />
<br />
Bottle finish is a bit glossier so it doesnt look as luxe as the gold. Red is much darker than it looks in photos, more of a burgundy. Bottle is better made, it has a soft click mechanism that glides into place whereas the original has a loud clicky close. Nozzle also sprays more in an even mist in no. 3<br />
<br />
Layering: absolutely divine combined. Sugary base of no. 1 with the slightly more masculine resin and pine and pepper peaking through. Start with no. 1 as its much stronger than no. 3 and will cover it up completely if layered on second.<br />
<br />
I don't have no. 2 to compare this to, but I'm really sad this is limited edition because it's addicting.<br />
<br />
This is definitely a more mature fragrance that probably wouldn't appeal to a teenage crowd the way no. 1 would (though even then no. 1 is itself surprisingly mature for a celeb perfume). I wouldn't gift this to someone (stick to no. 1 for gifts) unless I knew what they liked. I love this scent as a woman and think it would be absolutely wonderful for men too (leaning a little feminine but I personally like that).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="87945"comment_id="1979225"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html?ccid=1979225#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1979199" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1979199" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Christina J Louis"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1648714"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1648714.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Christina J Louis" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1979199ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1979199" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1648714">Christina J Louis</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-17">11/17/23 21:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have all three of the Eilish Fragrances and I genuinely think this is the best one out of the three. It is juicy grapefruit and spicy from the pink peppercorn but the saffron and fir do something beautiful to this fragrance that I just cant get enough of.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="87945"comment_id="1979199"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html?ccid=1979199#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1979093" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1979093" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Hcastillo04"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1366766"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Hcastillo04" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1979093ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1979093" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1366766">Hcastillo04</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-17">11/17/23 16:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Why ate people saying this smells like br540? It doesnt AT ALL, like not even close . It smells VERY piney &amp; spicey. Its not my vibe unfortunately. If I would have been able to smell this in store, I would not have bought it. It is very unisex though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="87945"comment_id="1979093"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html?ccid=1979093#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1978805" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1889302">thankunextbitch</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-17">11/17/23 09:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have all 3 in the collection now (eilish, no. 2, no. 3) and Im going to have to say this is my least favorite. Its NOT bad, but IMO not great. that grapefruit opening is really nice, compliments the saffron really well. but to my nose, especially in the dry down, this is entirely too reminiscent of By the Fireplace. theres something about BtF that I cant stand. Its a little too smoky and woody for me, and this is teetering on the edge of that. something Im going to have to give more time, but released perfectly in time for the season &amp; holidays.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1978273" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sarahbollmann"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1474215"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="sarahbollmann" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Coffee-Break-55926.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55926.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Coffee Break"title="Coffee Break"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1978273ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1978273" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1474215">sarahbollmann</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-16">11/16/23 14:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This has great longevity on me! I get way more saffron than pine which is very much to my liking. Warm, spicy but grounded scent with a lovely dry down. This might be my favorite of the 3 eilish, shame it's limited. I have been reaching for this everyday since I got it and I feel like this will work perfect when it's cold but also in spring or on a summer date. Lovely scent in a good pricepoint. <br />
<br />
Also the nozzle has been improved, it sprays really nicely and the color is darker than I expected.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="87945"comment_id="1978273"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html?ccid=1978273#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1978248" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1978248" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="miss_aly"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1382225"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1382225.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="miss_aly" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-70052.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70052.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eilish"title="Eilish"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1978248ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1978248" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1382225">miss_aly</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-16">11/16/23 13:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really enjoy this one! It's definitely unisex and woodsy. My husband said I smelled like a campfire, but I love it! Longevity was just average, but hopefully it will be stronger once it macerates. Great scent for the fall! I plan to layer it with Vanilla Woods by 7 Virtues or Milk by Commodity to sweeten it up! (btw I really don't see this as a BR540 clone. Yeah I guess there's the hint of saffron in it? But this is much more woodsy....)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="87945"comment_id="1978248"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html?ccid=1978248#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1978228" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; 2 but replace the pepper note in no.2 with soft ginger spices and add a sweet pine tree. its woody but sweet and fresh. definitely has a holiday twang. So sad this is limited and cant make this my everyday fragrance..</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="87945"comment_id="1978228"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html?ccid=1978228#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1978209" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1978209" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mateenm"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1876165"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1876165.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mateenm" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Le-Male-Elixir-81642.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.81642.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Le Male Elixir"title="Le Male Elixir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1978209ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1978209" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1876165">Mateenm</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-16">11/16/23 13:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>OH. MY. GOD. THIS IS THE BEST FRAGRANCE IN THE 'EILISH' COLLECTION!!!! IT'S SWEET AND AMBERY AND SPICY AND SEXY AND EDIBLE AND JUST SO GOOODDD!!!!! </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="87945"comment_id="1978209"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html?ccid=1978209#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1977354" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1977354" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Deliza1997"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1874663"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1874663.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Deliza1997" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Initio-Parfums-Prives/Side-Effect-42260.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.42260.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Side Effect"title="Side Effect"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1977354ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1977354" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1874663">Deliza1997</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-15">11/15/23 12:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Finally I have managed a decant from my friend before committing to a full size bottle. To my nose It's a watered down BR540 with pine and a lot spices.It has a sharp, piney, spicy and citrus(grapefruit) opening. Reminds me of old school colognes. On the dry down it is faint mossy BR540 and the cologne is still there. It doesn't last for long and becomes a skin scent within 30 minutes.This is a fragrance that doesnt know what  it wants to be. A old school cologne with some BR540 DNA.<br />
I have a beef with the whole Eilish line but  somehow I liked the original Eilish which is also very synthetic and nauseating up-close but in the air It smells good and I straight up despise No2. Its kinda in the middle but not worth your time and money. Just skip it you will be better off without it.You can find better fragrances at this price point with great performance .A little younger demographic may find it great specially boys but nope It's a no for me.<br />
And please don't fall for the bottle which in my opinion is very nice and artsy. I fell for it and bought No 2 and regretted it. Billie you arent fooling me again. <br />
Note: I don't hate old school men's colognes, It is very subjective and depends on  individual scent profiles. Eillish 3 has a scent that is reminiscent of old school colognes also performs like a cologne at a much higher price that's my main problem.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="87945"comment_id="1977354"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html?ccid=1977354#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1976795" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1976795" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MCW7"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1441650"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1441650.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MCW7" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mugler/Aura-Mugler-45639.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45639.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aura Mugler"title="Aura Mugler"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1976795ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1976795" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1441650">MCW7</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-14">11/14/23 15:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Right now I consider this to be a extremely weak fragrance.  at first it opens up with a spicy sweet peppery scent, but on the dry down it is so reminiscent of baccarat rouge 540 (as if there isnt enough dupes for that one?) <br />
I have baccarat 540 .. yes, it does smell just like it on the dry down  the saffron is very dominant. I smell, no pine at all.. pink pepper yes .. I am hoping in a month or so. It will macerate and become a little stronger but as of right now really poor performance. I like it, but it is so close to baccarat. I dont know. I guess I expected a little bit more imagination very disappointed.. its nothing groundbreaking, unfortunately. ..is it worth the $72 plus shipping?  I dont think so. Its like a expensive, glorified body spray.. if I have any updates, I will come back, but right now I just dont see this as being a worthwhile purchase, unless you dont like people to smell you, including yourself. The other two perfumes are much stronger.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="87945"comment_id="1976795"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html?ccid=1976795#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1976353" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1976353" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CallHerAnUber"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1517928"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="CallHerAnUber" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.87945.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eilish No.3"title="Eilish No.3"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1976353ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1976353" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1517928">CallHerAnUber</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-14">11/14/23 05:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First of all, the performance is poor on me. I dont usually have trouble with this. <br />
<br />
The scent itself is difficult to pin down. The notes I detect the most are the grapefruit and pine. You might think this would be sharp but no, the effect of this perfume is soft and powdery. Soothing. <br />
<br />
I like it. Im not sure how much I like it yet, or what the appropriate use for this fragrance will be. Will it become my bedtime scent like Eilish No. 1? Probably.<br />
<br />
I dont see wearing this to get noticed. Nobody is going to smell this on me. Its more for personal aromatherapy and it only lasts longer than 30 minutes if I spray my clothing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="87945"comment_id="1976353"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html?ccid=1976353#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1976076" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1975927" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Starlight_moon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1170559"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1170559.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Starlight_moon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mes-Bisous/Amberique-73510.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.73510.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Amberique"title="Amberique"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1975927ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1975927" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1170559">Starlight_moon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-13">11/13/23 14:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Received my bottle today.<br />
The longevity is pretty decent, on par with the first fragrance- Eilish. Will last longer if sprayed on hair/clothes.<br />
The smell itself is very unisex and no, it does not resemble BR540, not even close. It does smell like pine needles, very reminiscent of man's cologne that was popular in the 80's , but it does have that spiciness that makes it a decent unisex fragrance and spiciness is more prominent than pine. Not sure how I feel about it, it's definitely not something I'd usually wear, I tend to leaning more towards the vanilla-based scents, but I do see it as a fragrance suitable for a cold weather. So, curious to see its performance in winter. <br />
The bottle itself is not as bright red as pictured in advertisement,  it's more dark and close to being a burgundy color.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="87945"comment_id="1975927"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html?ccid=1975927#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1975862" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1653182">scentedhiro</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-13">11/13/23 13:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Just received this one, havent tried it on my skin yet but on the card and in the bottle it smells like BR540 with an overdose of peppercorn. Will update once I finally wear this one.<br />
<br />
Update: Wearing it now for a few hours, not much of a fan personally. I don't know where people are getting cedar. I am exclusively getting BR540 with extra pepper in it. The pepper note is almost too sharp and headache inducing. Luckily, it doesn't last too long. Actually, the whole perfume doesn't last that long, with it only lasting about an hour on my skin. Not a fan personally... But at least the bottle is nice.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="87945"comment_id="1975862"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html?ccid=1975862#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1974418" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1565715">thepreppycricket</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-09">11/09/23 16:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sorry - I'm going to be a Debbie Downer here.<br />
<br />
The fragrances themselves are fine in my opinion. The bottle is fugly and embarrassing. I don't want that out in plain site. We all know a lot of money goes into creating a custom bottle for perfumes. Is the price you're paying really worth this fugly bottle? For me it's not.<br />
<br />
The article states this is the last of the "bust" fragrances. What is she going to put her next perfume in? A bottle of her nether regions?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="87945"comment_id="1972822"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html?ccid=1972822#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1972806" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1972806" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bajablast"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1261786"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1261786.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bajablast" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1972806ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1972806" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1261786">bajablast</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-09">11/09/23 16:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Billie was underage when she exploded on the music scene. With the amount of eyes on her, she understandably became overly conscious of her body and being modest in her clothing. When her first perfume was released in 2021 however, she had also shot her "scandalous" cover for British Vogue. What I see here is a young woman who takes control of her narrative and chooses to display her body as she pleases, when she pleases. I guess what I'm trying to say is, although I see how someone could quickly jump to the conclusion that this design objectifies women, there's more to the story behind these bottles and the celebrity name.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; No3 was uploaded. Fun timing. Perhaps it's just my phone being slow. In any case, I purchased No2 on the weekend at a pawn shop and was hoping for more to come. Looking forward to trying No3, but I'd love if Billie would do something more with No2. It's amazing... near perfection, with that Palo Santo note - I LOVE it, but the scent all together doesn't last long at all. Not long enough for me. I hope this gets remedied.<br />
<br />
I also hope No3 smells like wood as well and that it has a stronger longevity than mine. </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="87945"comment_id="1972779"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html?ccid=1972779#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>

Will update once I finally wear this one.<br />
<br />
Update: Wearing it now for a few hours, not much of a fan personally. I don't know where people are getting cedar. I am exclusively getting BR540 with extra pepper in it. The pepper note is almost too sharp and headache inducing. Luckily, it doesn't last too long. Actually, the whole perfume doesn't last that long, with it only lasting about an hour on my skin. Not a fan personally... But at least the bottle is nice.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="87945"comment_id="1975862"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-No-3-87945.html?ccid=1975862#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2098086" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; </div><div class="tabs-panel" id="search-reviews"><search-perfume-reviews :perfume_id="87945":random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]"></search-perfume-reviews></div></div><foundation-tabs></foundation-tabs></reviews-wrapper></div><perfume-shortcut-menu :perfume_id="87945" when-hidden="#toptop"></perfume-shortcut-menu><initialize-status-data></initialize-status-data><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_footer -->

    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');

</script>
